intro: Morisonia dressleri, commonly known as the Hawaiian morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas, often found in native forests and coastal habitats. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
